sense.name: a unit of length equal to 3 feet
sense.examples: Mary bought six yards of fabric for her wedding gown. The quarterback ran twenty yards for a touchdown. This table is not quite a yard wide.

sense.name: land surrounding a house and part of its property
sense.examples: The yard in front of the cottage was filled with wild flowers. John left the lawnmower in the side yard by the garden hose and wheelbarrow. This house features a fenced yard in back. Mary is having a yard sale on Saturday.

sense.name: a tract of land, often enclosed, used for specific purposes
sense.examples: Two ships were in dry dock in the navy yard. A rooster and several hens scratched about in the chicken yard. The prisoners were allowed to exercise two hours a day in the prison yard. Pieces of old machinery stood in the yard of the machine shop.

sense.name: a volume measure equal to 27 cubic feet
sense.examples: John ordered two cubic yards of mulch for his landscaping. How many cubic yards of gravel does that truck haul?

sense.name: long horizontal spar to support a square sail
sense.examples: The skipper noticed a crack in his main yard. The 18th-century sailing ship had very large yards to support the sails.

sense.name: tall narrow beer glass, about 3 feet high
sense.examples: The barmaid brought them two yards of good German ale. We ordered pints of beer, but Bob ordered a yard.

sense.name: winter habitat area for deer
sense.examples: The moose use the lower southern slope as their yard during the winter. Predators stalked the deer yard.

sense.name: the cardinal number 1000
sense.examples: The product of 10 times 100 is a yard. (1000)
